column1: The hyena and the monkey had an argument. They went to a judge to settle their differences. After the judge listened to their case
column2: he was afraid to pass judgement on their case. He thought to himself
column4: it will eat all my cattle. And if I condemn the monkey
column5: he will eat all my corn! So
column6: what am I to do?" The judge thought for a while
column8: "The case is too difficult for me to judge alone. You should go to the elders of the village." So
column9: the hyena and monkey went to the elders. They told the elders about their disagreement. After the elders listened to their case
column10: they were also afraid to pass judgement. If they supported the monkey
column11: the hyena might eat their cattle. If they supported the hyena
column12: the monkey might eat their corn. The elders told Hyena and Monkey that their case was very difficult. Suddenly
column13: the elders remembered a poor woman in the town. She had nothing to lose
column14: neither cattle nor corn. "She can pass the judgement without any fear
column15: said the elders to one another. They told the two animals to go to her.
